WhatsApp Facebook Commentary

It was imminent. Although I wasn’t sure it would be Facebook but WhatsApp looked definitely en route to an acquisition having failed to really monetize the messaging service.

Away from the money-game, I use Telegram messenger that is fast, safe and open. It’s available on almost all platforms possible. Go get it.

I collected some tweets/comments from my Twitter feed this morning regarding the acquisition.

Take a look:

Buying WhatsApp: $16B Additional stock for employees: $3B Getting to evesdrop on 450 million people’s private conversations: priceless.

— Aral Balkan (@aral) February 20, 2014

For $16 billion dollars, that better be one hell of a massage. pic.twitter.com/rB0Sv8kdXM

— Ryan Shattuck (@ryanmer) February 19, 2014

My 3-year plan: 1. Create a startup that challenges Facebook's dominance of color blue #3B5998. 2. Get acquired by Facebook for $20B.

— Kontra (@counternotions) February 19, 2014

When a chat app is "worth" $19 billion, but the average household can't get healthcare, stability, or opportunity, something's wrong.

— umair haque (@umairh) February 19, 2014

Whatsapp sold for 1/10 of the Ukraine's GDP

— ashton kutcher (@aplusk) February 20, 2014

Photos/day? Instagram: 35M Facebook: 350M SnapChat: 400M WhatsApp: 500M Apple & Android missed out. It’s their cameras!

— Aaron Batalion (@abatalion) February 20, 2014

Perspective: Netflix: $25.6B Tesla: $23.7B Macy's: $19.7B WhatsApp: $19B Whole Foods: $19B Gap: $18.9B Sony: $17.7B United Airlines: $15.7B

— dustin curtis (@dcurtis) February 20, 2014

Facebook buys WhatsApp for 19billon. Meanwhile Twitter can’t send urls in DMs.

— Bicky Bhullar (@BickyBhullar) February 20, 2014

‘Mark Zuckerberg stated that WhatsApp is "on a path to connect 1 billion people.”’ Man, if I had $16 for each Pinboard user… wait, I do!

— Pinboard (@Pinboard) February 20, 2014

New best practice: Get rejected from a job, then sell your company to that same company and become a billionaire.

— Aaron Levie (@levie) February 20, 2014

The WhatsApp purchase would fund St. Jude for 23 years.

— Stephen Hackett (@ismh) February 20, 2014

19 #Instagram = 1 #WhatsApp pic.twitter.com/0szVe3AaQu

— Amit Agarwal (@labnol) February 20, 2014

32 people built an Internet product that let half a billion people flawlessly communicate in real time. Don't trivialize that. #whatsapp

— Dustin Mierau (@dmierau) February 20, 2014

Calm down people, we're all just idiots with phones.

— Mmmkay? (@missekay) February 18, 2014

And the last one is pure gold.

WhatsApp founder Brian Acton was denied a job at Facebook in 2009. He decided to do his own thing and look where that got him today! $19bn in cash.

Facebook turned me down. It was a great opportunity to connect with some fantastic people. Looking forward to life's next adventure.

— Brian Acton (@brianacton) August 3, 2009
Published on February 20, 2014.

Epilogue
